hy-AM.alice_beyond_longdescription: Using an innovative programming environment to support the creation of 3D animations, the Alice Project provides tools and materials for teaching and learning computational thinking, problem solving, and computer programming across a spectrum of ages and grade levels.
hy-AM.allcancode_longdescription: Students play an adventure game based on an original story. They guide Marco - the main character - through each level by giving him step-by-step instructions in the form of the visual programming language used by the Hour of Code. They get introduced to sequencing commands, iteration and conditions without even noticing it.
hy-AM.allcancode_shortdescription: An immersive game to guide Marco with a visual programming language.
hy-AM.appinventor_beyond_longdescription: Entertaining, quick video tutorials walk you through building three simple apps for your Android phone or tablet. Designed for novices and experts alike, this hour of code will get you ready to start building your own apps before you know it. Imagine sharing your own app creations with your friends! These activities are suitable for individuals and for teachers leading classes.
hy-AM.appinventor_longdescription: Entertaining, quick video tutorials walk you through building three simple apps for your Android phone or tablet. Designed for novices and experts alike, this hour of code will get you ready to start building your own apps before you know it. Imagine sharing your own app creations with your friends! These activities are suitable for individuals and for teachers leading classes.
hy-AM.applab_shortdescription_congrats: App Lab is a programming environment where you can make simple apps. Design an app, code with blocks or JavaScript to make it work, then share your app in seconds
hy-AM.arduino_beyond_longdescription: Arduino is a popular platform designed to allow artists and designers to work with real sensors, LEDs, buzzers, and more. The Sparkfun Virtual Sandbox will teach you real Arduino code right in your browser.
hy-AM.arduino_beyond_shortdescription: Learn Arduino with Sparkfun's Digital Sandbox.
hy-AM.artist_shortdescription: Draw cool pictures and designs with the Artist!
hy-AM.beyond_hour_message: Keep going with our other courses, or see more options to Learn beyond an Hour.
hy-AM.beyond_submission: Want to submit a tutorial for Beyond an Hour? See the criteria and submission form.
hy-AM.bitsbox_longdescription: Customize your very own virtual tablet, then code a series of apps to play and share. Simple walkthroughs make it possible for even young kids to program real JavaScript, and the more advanced you are the further you'll go.
hy-AM.bitsbox_shortdescription: Code a series of apps to play and share, using real JavaScript.
hy-AM.blockly_longdescription: Got PCs with slow (or non-existent) internet access? Download the Blockly tutorials that were the precursor of the Code.org tutorials - a single 3MB ZIP file can be loaded onto any computer or used off a memory stick
hy-AM.blockly_shortdescription: Download a ZIP file to learn offline
hy-AM.boxisland_longdescription: Take a trip on Box Island and help Hiro collect all the clocks scattered in the wilderness! In this tutorial you will learn the basics of algorithms, sequences, loops and conditionals!
hy-AM.boxisland_shortdescription: Take a coding trip on Box Island with the brave Hiro.
hy-AM.california_heading: Ask your school to teach computer science
hy-AM.california_text: Any teacher can offer our free courses. Any elementary school can teach computer science. Ask high schools to partner with us.
hy-AM.cargobot_beyond_longdescription: Cargo-Bot is a puzzle game where you teach a robot how to move crates. Sounds simple, right? It features 36 fiendishly clever puzzles, haunting music and stunning retina graphics. You can even record your solutions and share them on YouTube to show your friends.
hy-AM.cargobot_beyond_shortdescription: Program a robot arm on your iPad
hy-AM.carousel_heading_apps_games: Make your own apps or games
hy-AM.carousel_heading_beyond_devices: Tutorial apps for phones and tablets
hy-AM.carousel_heading_devices: Partner tutorial apps for phones and tablets
hy-AM.carousel_heading_languages: Partner tutorials in other programming languages
hy-AM.carousel_heading_unplugged: No device or internet? Try 'unplugged' computer science
hy-AM.class_submission_in_school_programming_i: Programming integrated in other classes (math, science, etc)
hy-AM.code_hoc_coming: The Hour of Code is here - December 8-14!
hy-AM.code_sign_up: Sign up to participate during CS Education Week
hy-AM.codea_beyond_longdescription: Codea for iPad lets you create games and simulations — or just about any visual idea you have. Turn your thoughts into interactive creations that make use of iPad features like Multi-Touch and the accelerometer. We think Codea is the most beautiful code editor you'll use, and it's easy. Codea is designed to let you touch your code. Want to change a number? Just tap and drag it. How about a color, or an image? Tapping will bring up visual editors that let you choose exactly what you want.
hy-AM.codeavengers_beyond_longdescription: Learn how to program games, apps and websites. Designed by experts with perfect level of difficulty for beginners, easy to understand instructions and great help when you need it. Our HTML, CSS and JavaScript courses include code challenges and revision games that make learning fun and effective for all ages.
hy-AM.codeavengers_beyond_shortdescription: Learn to code games and websites
hy-AM.codeavengers_longdescription: Build a 2 player 2D top-down game with JavaScript in 10 short tasks. Then continue learning some basics of programming (variables and if statements) as you create a Quiz to share with friends. Along the way  earn points and badges as you compete to reach the top of the class leaderboard.
hy-AM.codeavengers_shortdescription: Learn JavaScript programming, in a web-browser
hy-AM.codecademy_beyond_longdescription: Codecademy is an interactive, student-guided introduction to the basics of CS through JavaScript that's used by tens of millions of students around the world. We've prepared a no-hassle Hour of Code experience with accompanying quizzes, slides, and a completed project for students at the end.
hy-AM.codecademy_beyond_platformtext: Modern web browsers. iOS, Android apps
hy-AM.codecademy_beyond_shortdescription: Learn JavaScript programming, in a web-browser
hy-AM.codecademy_longdescription: Codecademy is an interactive, student-guided introduction to the basics of CS through JavaScript that's used by tens of millions of students around the world. We've prepared a no-hassle Hour of Code experience with accompanying quizzes, slides, and a completed project for students at the end.
hy-AM.codecademy_platformtext: Modern web browsers. iOS, Android apps
hy-AM.codecademy_shortdescription: Learn JavaScript programming, in a web-browser
hy-AM.codecombat_beyond_longdescription: Play as a Wizard using code (spells) to control your heroes, navigate mazes, defeat ogres, trick enemies, and rescue allies! Learn JavaScript in this HTML 5 web game for complete beginners.
hy-AM.codecombat_beyond_shortdescription: Play a game and learn JavaScript to win
hy-AM.codecombat_longdescription: Defeat ogres to learn Python or JavaScript in this epic programming game!
hy-AM.codecombat_shortdescription: Defeat ogres to learn Python or JavaScript in this epic programming game!
hy-AM.codehs_beyond_longdescription: Learn the basics of programming with Karel the Dog, a fun, accessible and visual introduction to coding, where giving commands to a computer is just like giving commands to a dog. This tutorial is great if led by a teacher, but can also be done independently. [Note: payment is required]
hy-AM.codehs_beyond_name: Learn to Code With Karel the Dog
hy-AM.codehs_beyond_shortdescription: Learn JavaScript programming with a fun visual environment
hy-AM.codehs_longdescription: Giving commands to a computer, which is what programming is all about, is just like giving commands to a dog. Learn how to code with Karel the Dog—a fun, accessible, and visual introduction to programming that teaches fundamental concepts like commands and functions to absolute beginners. Tutorial is student-directed but teachers can sign up to access teacher tools and track student success!
hy-AM.codehs_name: Learn to Code With Karel the Dog
hy-AM.codehs_shortdescription: Start coding with Karel the Dog, a fun and visual intro to programming!
hy-AM.codeintl_longdescription: Learn the basic concepts of Computer Science with drag and drop programming. This is a game-like, self-directed tutorial starring video lectures by Bill Gates, Mark Zuckerberg, Angry Birds and Plants vs. Zombies. Learn repeat-loops, conditionals, and basic algorithms. Available in 34 languages.
hy-AM.codeintl_shortdescription: Learn to code with Mark Zuckerberg and Angry Birds!
hy-AM.codemonkey_longdescription: CodeMonkey is an online game that teaches coding in a real programming language! Students program a monkey to catch bananas while it gets slightly more complicated on each level. They get star scores on each solution and can share it in a single click.
hy-AM.codemonkey_shortdescription: Students program a monkey to catch bananas.
hy-AM.codeorg_beyond_longdescription: Learn the basic concepts of Computer Science with drag and drop programming. 3 full courses, each consists of 15-20 lessons that blend "unplugged" classroom activities interspersed with game-like, self-directed tutorials starring video lectures by Bill Gates, Mark Zuckerberg, Angry Birds and Plants vs. Zombies. Learn repeat-loops, conditionals, basic algorithms, functions, and variables.
hy-AM.codeorg_beyond_shortdescription: Learn to code with Mark Zuckerberg and Angry Birds!
hy-AM.codeorg_longdescription: Learn the basic concepts of Computer Science with drag and drop programming. This is a game-like, self-directed tutorial starring video lectures by Bill Gates, Mark Zuckerberg, Angry Birds and Plants vs. Zombies. Learn repeat-loops, conditionals, and basic algorithms. Available in 34 languages.
hy-AM.codeorg_shortdescription: Learn to code with Mark Zuckerberg and Angry Birds!
hy-AM.codespark_longdescription: The Foos is a fun and kid-friendly way to learn about computer programming.  Program cute characters to solve puzzles and bring a virtual world to life.  The game is "word free" so all can play!
hy-AM.codespark_shortdescription: The Foos is a fun, kid-friendly game to learn about programming.
hy-AM.codesters_longdescription: Create your own games, animations, and artwork using Python.  Once you’re done, share them with friends! Program in Python, a real programming language used every day at companies - our drag and drop toolkit makes it easy to learn!  Try building a basketball game, choreographing a dance, or designing an animated card!
hy-AM.codesters_shortdescription: Create your own games, animations, and artwork using Python.
hy-AM.compatibility_unsupported_browser: Your browser is not supported. Please upgrade your browser to one of our supported browsers. You can try viewing the page, but expect functionality to be broken.
hy-AM.compatibility_unsupported_browser_markdo: Your browser is not supported. Please upgrade your browser to one of our supported browsers. You can try viewing the page, but expect functionality to be broken.
hy-AM.condcards_longdescription: Learn about algorithms and conditional statements in this "unplugged" activity using a deck of cards. Students do this activity in teams, and need one deck of cards per team.
hy-AM.condcards_shortdescription: Learn algorithms with a deck of cards
hy-AM.congrats_guest_speaker_desc: Now that your students have finished a computer science course, consider celebrating and connecting it to things they can build in the real world by inviting a guest speaker to your classroom. You can use our map of volunteers to contact local volunteers to visit your classroom, or search in any city to find computer science students or technical professionals who are ready to inspire your students remotely, via video chat.
hy-AM.congrats_guest_speaker_title: Find a guest speaker for your classroom
hy-AM.congrats_next_tutorials_desc: Try these shorter, 1 hour tutorials or try a partner tutorial.
hy-AM.congrats_third_party_title: Use your new skills with these apps and websites
hy-AM.congratulations_on_completing_hoc: Congratulations on completing one Hour of Code
hy-AM.congratulations_volunteer: Congratulations: Now that you’ve tried the Hour of Code, sign up to volunteer in a classroom and help students learn an Hour of Code!
hy-AM.continue_learning_body: There are lots of options.  You can learn online, or at a local school, or summer camp.
hy-AM.course2_shortdescription_congrats: For students with basic reading skills, this course builds on Course 1. Students will create programs to solve problems and develop interactive games or stories they can share. Recommended for grades 2-5.
hy-AM.course3_shortdescription_congrats: Ready for the next level? Students will delve deeper into programming topics introduced in previous courses to find flexible solutions to more complex problems. By the end of this course, students create interactive stories and games they can share with anyone. Recommended for grades 4-5.
hy-AM.course4_shortdescription_congrats: Ready to go further? Students will delve deeper into programming topics introduced in previous courses to find flexible solutions to more complex problems. By the end of this course, students create interactive stories and games they can share with anyone. Recommended for grades 4-8.
hy-AM.coursera_beyond_longdescription: Stanford's CS 101 class taught by Nick Parlante (FREE!). CS101 teaches the essential ideas of Computer Science for a zero-prior-experience audience. Play and experiment with short bits of code to bring to life to the power and limitations of computers. CS101 also provides a general background on computers today: what is a computer, what is hardware, what is software, what is the internet. No previous experience is required other than the ability to use a web browser.
hy-AM.create_art_with_zombie: or make advanced art with zombie
hy-AM.csedweek_banner_hoc: The Hour of Code is coming. Calling all teachers and organizers, plan your Hour of Code
hy-AM.csedweek_banner_teachers: Are you a CS teacher? See other CSEdWeek resources
hy-AM.csedweek_map_header: # CSEdWeek / Hour of Code events around the world
hy-AM.csedweek_map_search_placeholder: Search for Hour of Code events
hy-AM.csedweek_og_description: Every student in every school deserves the opportunity to study computer science. It's changing everything.
hy-AM.csfirst_longdescription: Create a story about two characters at sea. Animate the water, and customize the scenery to add your own flair. Use code to tell the story you want to tell!
hy-AM.csfirst_shortdescription: Animate a story about two characters on the ocean. Add your own style!
hy-AM.dashboard_assessments_none_part2: If you are teaching a middle or high school course, we have assessment questions available as part of Code Studio to help your students prepare for the AP test. To use these assessments, first assign the course to your class and then pick the course from the drop down above and you'll see your students' answers here.
hy-AM.dashboard_course_csina_desc: Code.org has partnered with Bootstrap to develop a curriculum which teaches algebraic and geometric concepts through computer programming.
hy-AM.dashboard_course_csins_desc: Code.org has partnered with Project GUTS to deliver an introduction to computer science concepts within the context of modeling and simulation.
hy-AM.dashboard_course_csp_desc: Code.org has designed a rigorous, engaging, and approachable course that explores the foundational ideas of computing.
hy-AM.dashboard_course_ecs_desc: Exploring Computer Science is a yearlong course consisting of 6 units: Human Computer Interaction, Problem Solving, Web Design, Programming, Computing and Data Analysis, and Robotics.
hy-AM.dashboard_error_none_selected: You didn't select any students to move. Please select at least one student.
hy-AM.dashboard_error_other_section: If you're moving students between your own sections, select your section from the dropdown. Only select 'Other Section' to move your students to a different teacher's section.
hy-AM.dashboard_high_courses_desc: Our high school program helps school districts offer full-year computer science classes by preparing existing teaching staff to offer this new field. To register for professional development workshops, apply for a district-wide partnership with Code.org.
hy-AM.dashboard_hoc_courses: The Hour of Code for All Ages
hy-AM.dashboard_hoc_courses_desc: Try any of these shorter 1 hour tutorials with your students!
hy-AM.dashboard_hoc_courses_desc_and_cta: Try these short, one-hour tutorials with your students. Join the Hour of Code movement during Computer Science Education Week.
hy-AM.dashboard_k5_courses_desc: These courses blend online, self-guided and self-paced tutorials with "unplugged" activities that require no computer at all. Each course consists of about 20 lessons that may be implemented as one unit or over the course of a semester. Even kindergarten-aged pre-readers can participate. To help you get started, we offer high quality professional development workshops around the U.S. free of charge. Find one near you!
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_available_courses: Here are the courses currently available for you and your students.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_educator_blog: Կարդալ մասին նորություններից եւ թարմացումներից մեր նյութերի մեր մանկավարժ Օրագիր
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_inspire: Inspire your students with posters, videos, and more.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_more_tutorials: Want to see even more tutorials?
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_more_tutorials_desc: There are more tutorials offered by our partners. Learn to program with robots, make web pages, make your own app, or explore other languages like C++, Ruby, or Python!
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_new_beta: New! Try our beta courses for K-5 students.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_new_k5courses: New! Try our courses for K-5 students.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_office_hours: Ask a question in person! Visit our monthly video office hours.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_print_certificates: Տպագիր վկայականներ ուսանողների համար, ովքեր ավարտել այս դասընթացը
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_progress_biggest: This is the progress for your biggest section.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_report_bug: Request a feature or report a bug.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_video_library: Use a video from the Video Library of computer science concepts.
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_video_player: Test մեր նոր տեսամագնիտոֆոն ձեր դպրոցում
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_view_as_student: View this site as a student
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_watch_video: for a tour of the new features!
hy-AM.dashboard_landing_welcome: Welcome to the new and improved teacher dashboard.
hy-AM.dashboard_middle_courses_desc: Our middle school curriculum uses computer science and programming within the context of middle school math and science - as a tool to teach math and science concepts. To register for professional development workshops, apply for a district-wide partnership with Code.org.
hy-AM.dashboard_privacy_document_link: Click here for our privacy document that can be shared or printed for your students.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_both_sections: Would you like the student(s) to be in both sections?
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_choose_secret: If you would like to provide accounts to your students, choose a secret type of word or picture for that section.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_email_question: Do all students have a valid email address?
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_jumbotron_instruction: Create new sections and add students to them. Sections help you organize students into smaller groups so you can track their progress and manage their accounts.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_login_type_explanatio: This table helps explain which of these login types, picture, word, or email, you'll want to choose for a section.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_move_students_desc: Select students to move to a new section. Moving students will not clear their progress.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_no_move: No, I want to move student(s) to be in the new section only.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_one_per_teacher: Students can only be in one section for each teacher. Your students will be added to this new section and leave their old section.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_password_question: What do students use as a "password"?
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_print_secrets: You may then print a sheet of cards containing account information to be distributed to your students individually.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_secret_none: If you would like your students to manage their own accounts, including choosing their own passwords, choose a secret type of none.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_secret_picture: A picture allows you to set a secret picture for each student, ideal for younger students who can't yet type.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_secret_word: A word allows you to set a secret word for each student.
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_sign_in_unique: Unique web-page listed on "Manage Students" tab
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_word_account_creation: A simple word assigned by Code.org
hy-AM.dashboard_sections_yes_both: Yes, I want to copy student(s) to be in this current section AND the new section
hy-AM.dashboard_students_add_multiple: Type or paste the names of your students, one per line:
hy-AM.dashboard_students_join_link: Tell your students to create their own accounts and join your section at
hy-AM.dashboard_students_new_section: You've created a new section! Now add your students using the Add student and Add multiple students buttons above.
hy-AM.dashboard_students_no_email: If your students do not have email addresses, or you would like to create accounts for them, change this section's secret type to word or picture.
hy-AM.dashboard_students_print_info: Print out cards with your students' login information.
hy-AM.dashboard_students_reset_picture: You may reset a student's secret picture at any time by choosing Show secret and then Reset secret. A new secret picture will be generated for that student to use when they sign in.
hy-AM.dashboard_students_reset_word: You may reset a student's secret words at any time by choosing Show secret and then Reset secret. A new pair of secret words will be generated for that student to use when they sign in.
hy-AM.dashboard_students_secret_picture: This section uses picture as its secret type. It means that each of your students has a secret picture used in place of a password to sign in. Students should use the sign in web address given above to sign in.
hy-AM.dashboard_students_secret_word: This section uses word as its secret type. It means that each of your students has a pair of secret words used in place of a password to sign in. Students should use the sign in web address given above to sign in.
hy-AM.dashboard_students_share_section: Share this section's sign in page with your students:
hy-AM.dashboard_unplugged: If you don't have computers, try these unplugged lessons in your classroom.
hy-AM.edx_beyond_longdescription: CS50x is Harvard College's introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming for majors and non-majors alike, with or without prior programming experience. Topics include abstraction, algorithms, data structures, encapsulation, resource management, security, software engineering, and web development. Languages include C, PHP, and JavaScript plus SQL, CSS, and HTML. The on-campus version of CS50x is Harvard's second-largest course.
hy-AM.edx_beyond_shortdescription: The most popular class at Harvard
hy-AM.enter_country: Enter country if outside the United States
hy-AM.enter_valid_email: Please enter a valid email address
hy-AM.finch_beyond_longdescription: The Finch is a new robot for computer science education. Its design is the result of a four year study at Carnegie Mellon's CREATE lab. The Finch is designed to support an engaging introduction to the art of programming. It has support for over a dozen programming languages and environments, including several environments appropriate for students as young as eight years old. The Finch was designed to allow students to write richly interactive programs.
hy-AM.finch_beyond_shortdescription: A robot for computer science education
hy-AM.flappy_longdescription: Use drag-and-drop programming to make your own Flappy Bird game, and customize it to look different (Flappy Shark, Flappy Santa, whatever). Add the game to your phone in one click.
hy-AM.flappy_shortdescription: Make your own game - Flappy Bird, Shark, or Submarine
hy-AM.flappy_text:
Code.org just turned 1 year old.

Celebrate with us by making your own custom Flappy game. Code your own rules, and share it with friends!
hy-AM.frozen_longdescription: Let's use code to join Anna and Elsa as they explore the magic and beauty of ice. You will create snowflakes and patterns as you ice-skate and make a winter wonderland that you can then share with your friends!
hy-AM.frozen_shortdescription: Let's use code to join Anna and Elsa as they explore the magic and beauty of ice.
hy-AM.get_a_certificate_message: We'll send you a certificate and information about how to Learn beyond an Hour
hy-AM.get_a_certificate_message_after: Click on the certificate to download or print it. Now, keep going with our other courses, or see more options to Learn beyond an Hour.
hy-AM.groklearning_beyond_longdescription: An introductory course using the programming language Python for people with no programming experience. Our unique mix of introductory content and challenges will bring you to a thorough understanding of Python and programming itself. We've taught this content to students of varying ages from diverse backgrounds and we're sure it'll suit you too.
hy-AM.groklearning_longdescription: Use the programming language Python to build a chatbot called "Eliza" to act as a robot psychotherapist. You'll teach Eliza how to talk and the right thing to say. Can she fool your friends into thinking she's a human not a computer?
hy-AM.groklearning_shortdescription: Teach "Eliza" the chatbot to fool your friends into thinking she's human!
hy-AM.hacketyhack_beyond_longdescription: Hackety Hack will teach you the absolute basics of programming from the ground up. No previous programming experience is needed! With Hackety Hack, you'll learn the Ruby programming language. Ruby is used for all kinds of programs, including desktop applications and websites. [Note: Desktop install required]
hy-AM.hacketyhack_beyond_shortdescription: Learn Ruby from the ground up
hy-AM.help_recruit_coders: Help us recruit more coders to your team!
hy-AM.hoc2014_try_frozen: Արվեստագետ Աննայի հետ եւ Էլզա, սառեցրած
hy-AM.hoc2014_try_new_tutorial: Փորձեք մեր նոր ժամին օրենսգրքի ձեռնարկը բետա
hy-AM.hoc2014_try_new_tutorials: Try our new Hour of Code tutorials
hy-AM.hoc2014_whatishoc: What is the Hour of Code?
hy-AM.hoc2018_mc_details: Շատ լեզուներ | Ժամանակակից դիտարկիչներ և պլանշետներ | 8 տարեկանից
hy-AM.hoc2018_mc_watch_videos: Before you get started, watch one of these inspirational videos
hy-AM.hoc_is_here: Ուսումնասիրեք ինֆորմատիկա, այն փոխում է ամեն ինչ. https://youtu.be/KsOIlDT145A:
hy-AM.homepage_action_text_hoc: An Hour of Code for every student.
hy-AM.homepage_banner_20k_teachers: 20,000 teachers trained, and now teaching computer science in classrooms.
hy-AM.homepage_banner_congress: America's leaders are calling on Congress to fund K-12 computer science.
hy-AM.homepage_banner_link_prizes: Join the largest learning event in history.
hy-AM.homepage_banner_text_main: Code.org and the College Board form an alliance to improve diversity in computer science.
hy-AM.homepage_banner_text_prizes: The Hour of Code is coming again, December 7-13.
hy-AM.homepage_hero_text_stat_loc: 2.5 միլին աղջիկներ են սովորում Code Studio-ի միջոցով
hy-AM.homepage_hero_text_teacher2:
“ Այս ծրագիրը օգնեց իմ բոլոր աշակերտներին.”
Adam, ուսուցիչ
hy-AM.homepage_slot_text_blurb_hoc: Յուրաքանչյուրը կարող է սովորել. Սկսիր այսօր.
hy-AM.homepage_solot_text_link_volunteer: Volunteer for the Hour of Code
hy-AM.hopscotch_beyond_longdescription: Student-guided tutorial on the iPad using the Hopscotch programming language. Students will build games and apps for their iPad on their iPad. Students can work individually or with friends (up to 3 per iPad).
hy-AM.hopscotch_beyond_shortdescription: Learn visual programming on an iPad
hy-AM.hourofcode_shortdescription: Learn to code with Mark Zuckerberg and Angry Birds!
hy-AM.how_to_teach_hoc: How to Teach an Hour of Code
hy-AM.if_you_enjoyed: If you enjoyed learning, ask friends to try it too!  We want the whole world to learn.
hy-AM.infinity_shortdescription: Use Play Lab to create a story or game starring Disney Infinity characters.
hy-AM.just_did_accelerated: I just finished the Accelerated Course - check it out! @codeorg
hy-AM.just_did_course1: I just finished Course 1 - check it out! @codeorg
hy-AM.just_did_course2: I just finished Course 2 - check it out! @codeorg
hy-AM.just_did_course3: I just finished Course 3 - check it out! @codeorg
hy-AM.just_did_course4: I just finished Course 4 - check it out! @codeorg
hy-AM.just_did_hoc: I just did the #HourOfCode - check it out! @codeorg
hy-AM.khan_beyond_longdescription: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!
hy-AM.khan_longdescription: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!
hy-AM.khanes_longdescription: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!
hy-AM.khanfr_longdescription: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!
hy-AM.khanhe_longdescription: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!
hy-AM.khanpl_longdescription: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!
hy-AM.khanpt_longdescription: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming while creating fun drawings with your code. Do it on your own or with your class!
hy-AM.kidsruby_beyond_longdescription: Have fun and make games, or hack your homework using Ruby! Just tell your parents or teachers you're learning Ruby programming... ;). Free and works on any computer. [Note: Desktop install required]
hy-AM.kodable_beyond_longdescription: Kodable is a self-guided iPad game that introduces kids 5+ to programming basics. Having a teacher or parent nearby is optimal, but not necessary.
hy-AM.kodable_beyond_shortdescription: A fun iPad game to teach computer programming concepts
hy-AM.kodable_longdescription: Kodable is a self-guided iPad game that introduces kids 5+ to programming basics. Having a teacher or parent nearby is optimal, but not necessary.
hy-AM.kodable_shortdescription: A fun iPad game to teach computer programming concepts
hy-AM.kodableunplugged_longdescription: Designed for use with plain paper, the fuzzFamily Frenzy is an introduction to programming logic for kids 5 and up. A teacher should explain the game, then students program a partner to complete a simple obstacle course.
hy-AM.kodu_beyond_longdescription: Kodu lets kids create games on the PC and XBox via a simple visual programming language. Kodu can be used to teach creativity, problem solving, storytelling, as well as programming. Anyone can use Kodu to make a game, young children as well as adults with no design or programming skills. Kodu for the PC is available to download for free. Kodu for the XBox is also available in the USA on the XBox Marketplace, in the Indie Games channel for about $5.
hy-AM.leaderboards_for_hoc: Leaderboards for the Hour of Code.
hy-AM.learn_are_you_educator: Are you an educator? Learn how to teach an Hour of Code
hy-AM.learn_banner_desc: Hour of Code-ը միջազգային է, այն միացնում է 100 միլիոն ուսանողներիէ 180 երկրից: Ձեզանից ամեն մեկը կարող է կազմակերպել Hour of Code դասընթացներ: Օգնեք մեզ, ամեն մի ուսանողի, տալ հնարավորություն սովորել ՏՏ ոլորտում: Կազմակերպիչները կարող են հետևել մեզ հետևյալ ինչպես ձեռնարկին. Այս տեսանյութերը սովորեցնում և ներշնչում են մեր ուսանողներին:
hy-AM.learn_cs_concepts: Learn the basic concepts of Computer Science with drag and drop programming. This is a game-like tutorial starring video lectures by Bill Gates, Mark Zuckerberg, Angry Birds and Plants vs. Zombies. Learn repeat-loops, if-then statements, and basic algorithms.
hy-AM.learn_educator_resources_description: Learn how to teach an Hour of Code
hy-AM.learn_find_volunteer: Find a local volunteer to help during your Hour of Code
hy-AM.learn_footer_all_tutorials: See the comprehensive list of Hour of Code tutorials. To see our criteria and submission guidelines for Hour of Code tutorials, click here.
hy-AM.learn_hoc_prizes: Learn more about the prizes for every educator, while supplies last
hy-AM.learn_how_to_hoc: Follow our how-to guide for teaching one Hour of Code
hy-AM.learn_inspirational_videos: Inspire students by showing them these videos
hy-AM.learn_sign_up_description: Sign up to participate in the Hour of Code during CS Education Week
hy-AM.learn_teacher_led_lesson_plans: Be inspired by teacher led Hour of Code lesson plans
hy-AM.learn_videos_before_hoc: Watch an inspirational video before your Hour of Code
hy-AM.learn_videos_show: Show this inspirational video to your class
hy-AM.learn_videos_watch: Watch this inspirational video with your classroom
hy-AM.lego_beyond_longdescription: Create small, customizable and programmable robots using LEGO pieces.
hy-AM.lightbot_beyond_longdescription: Learn core programming logic, starting from super-basic programming, for ages 4+, on iOS or Android (or Web browser) . Learn how to sequence commands, identify patterns, use procedures, and utilize loops!
hy-AM.lightbot_beyond_shortdescription: A game to teach coding concepts
hy-AM.lightbot_longdescription: Guide Lightbot to light up all the blue tiles! Lightbot is a puzzle game that uses programming game mechanics to let players gain a practical understanding of basic coding. Learn to sequence instructions, write procedures, and utilize loops to solve levels. Ideal for all ages.
hy-AM.lightbot_platformtext: ALL browsers and iOS, Android, or Game Console
hy-AM.lightbot_shortdescription: Program Lightbot to solve puzzles using procedures and loops!
hy-AM.lightbotintl_longdescription: Learn core programming logic, starting from super-basic programming, for ages 4+, on iOS or Android (or Web browser) . Learn how to sequence commands, identify patterns, use procedures, and utilize loops!
hy-AM.lightbotintl_shortdescription: A game to teach coding concepts
hy-AM.lines_of_code: OVER # LINES OF CODE WRITTEN TO DATE.
hy-AM.lines_of_code_alt: # LINES OF CODE WRITTEN BY STUDENTS
hy-AM.lynda_beyond_longdescription: Learn how to code, create, and build web applications, from the foundations of object-oriented programming in C and C++, to how to write Java. Our developer tutorials can help you learn to develop and create mobile apps, work with PHP and MySQL databases, get started with the statistical processing language R, and much more. [Note: payment is required]
hy-AM.makeschool_beyond_longdescription: Know some ObjectiveC? Learn to make an iPhone game in an hour! We'll guide you through the process, to code, test, and play your game entirely in the browser and then share it on Facebook for friends to try! No prior iPhone development experience is required. You must understand what variables, methods, and objects are.
hy-AM.makeschool_beyond_name: Build an iPhone game in your browser!
hy-AM.makeschool_beyond_shortdescription: Learn to make an iPhone game in an hour
hy-AM.makeschool_longdescription: Learn to code by making an iPhone game using a brand new and beginner-friendly programming language called Swift! Create a Pokémon-inspired action game and write code to teach your monster new moves. You will learn how to use variables, methods, and objects to help your monster win!
hy-AM.makeschool_name: Build an iPhone game in your browser!
hy-AM.makeschool_shortdescription: Make an iPhone game! Learn by writing code to teach your monster new moves!
hy-AM.mc_longdescription: Use blocks of code to take Steve or Alex on an adventure through this Minecraft world
hy-AM.mc_shortdescription: Use blocks of code to take Steve or Alex on an adventure through this Minecraft world
hy-AM.mc_specs: Many languages | Modern browsers and tablets | Ages 6-106
hy-AM.minecraft_specs: Շատ լեզուներ | Ժամանակակից դիտարկիչներ և պլանշետներ | 8 տարեկանից
hy-AM.monstercoding_longdescription: The Mystery Island Coding Quest by Monster Coding offers a fun filled self guided adventure that teaches several key programming concepts to children. Each block based activity builds on the previous, introducing kids to Functions, Boolean Values, Loops, If/Else Statements, and Arrays, using colorful animated graphics, audio instructions.
hy-AM.monsterocding_shortdescription: A colorful self-guided programming adventure for children.
hy-AM.more_resources_educators: More resources for teachers and educators
hy-AM.mozilla_beyond_longdescription: Thimble makes it ridiculously simple to create and share your own web pages. Write and edit HTML and CSS right in your browser, then instantly preview your work. Host and share your finished projects with a single click. Perfect for beginners and experts alike.
hy-AM.name: Անուն
hy-AM.og_description: Every student in every school deserves the opportunity to study computer science. It's changing everything.
hy-AM.older_systems: Partner tutorials that work on older systems
hy-AM.older_systems_subheading: These should work on older Web browsers. To access all tutorials, upgrade to a modern Web browser.
hy-AM.petition_message: Յուրաքանչյուր աշակերտ յուրաքանչյուր դպրոցում պետք է հնարավորություն ունենա սովորելու համակարգչային գիտություն
hy-AM.petition_sign_message: Եթե համաձայն եք, գրեք Ձեր անունը։ Գրանցվել։ #Այլ
hy-AM.petition_thankyou: Thank you for signing the petition
hy-AM.playlab_longdescription: Create a story or make a game with Play Lab! Make animals, pirates, zombies, ninjas, and many more characters move, make sounds, score points, and even throw fireballs!
hy-AM.playlab_shortdescription: Create a story or make a game with Play Lab!
hy-AM.pocketcode_beyond_longdescription: Create your own game on your smart phone with Pocket Code! Help skydiver Steve to deliver his parcels. You can share it with friends and other users to try!
hy-AM.pocketcode_beyond_shortdescription: Create a game on your smartphone and share with friends to try!
hy-AM.privacy_practices_children: See our privacy practices for children
hy-AM.processing_beyond_longdescription: Processing is a programming language, development environment, and online community. Since 2001, Processing has promoted software literacy within the visual arts and visual literacy within technology. Initially created to serve as a software sketchbook and to teach computer programming fundamentals within a visual context, Processing evolved into a development tool for professionals. Today, there are tens of thousands of students, artists, designers, researchers, and hobbyists who use Processing for learning, prototyping, and production.
hy-AM.processing_longdescription: An introduction to programming in the context of the visual arts using the Processing programming language. Short video lessons introduce coding exercises that lead to designing an interactive drawing program
hy-AM.processing_shortdescription: A one hour tutorial in the Processing languages
hy-AM.projguts_longdescription: This "unplugged" activity helps students learn how modeling and simulation works by having a group of students play different versions of the Rock / Paper / Scissors game, and see the results as different modeling experiments.
hy-AM.projguts_shortdescription: Try modeling and simulation using rock/paper/scissors
hy-AM.quorum_longdescription: This tutorial is accessible for the visually-impaired, and works with screenreaders. Join Mary on a tour as she joins a biology lab as a programmer and learns the Quorum programming language. This tutorial is student-guided with online example activities.
hy-AM.quorum_shortdescription: Join Mary on a guided tour as she learns the Quorum programming language.
hy-AM.review_lesson_plan: Նայեք դասի պլանը և ուսուցչի այլ նյութերը:
hy-AM.robomind_beyond_longdescription: Students learn the basics of programming by controling their own virtual robot. The online course is fully self-contained with short presentations, movies, quizzes and automatic guidance/hints to help with the programming exercises.
hy-AM.robomind_beyond_shortdescription: Write code for a virtual robot
hy-AM.robomind_longdescription: Students learn the basics of programming by controlling their own virtual robot. The online course is fully self-contained with short presentations, movies, quizzes and automatic guidance/hints to help with the programming exercises.
hy-AM.robomind_shortdescription: Write code for a virtual robot
hy-AM.robomindnl_longdescription: Students learn the basics of programming by controlling their own virtual robot. The online course is fully self-contained with short presentations, movies, quizzes and automatic guidance/hints to help with the programming exercises.
hy-AM.robomindnl_shortdescription: Write code for a virtual robot
hy-AM.scratch_beyond_longdescription: With Scratch, you can create your own interactive games, stories, animations — and share them with your friends. Get started by animating your name, creating a holiday card, or making a pong game.
hy-AM.scratch_beyond_shortdescription: Create interactive games, stories, and animations.
hy-AM.scratch_longdescription: With Scratch, you can create your own interactive games, stories, animations — and share them with your friends. Get started by animating your name, creating a holiday card, or making a pong game.
hy-AM.scratch_shortdescription: Create interactive games, stories, and animations.
hy-AM.scratchjr_beyond_longdescription: ScratchJr is an introductory programming language that enables young children to create their own interactive stories and games. Children snap together graphical programming blocks to make characters move, jump, dance, and sing
hy-AM.scratchjr_beyond_shortdescription: Create interactive stories and games using ScratchJr.
hy-AM.sphero_beyond_longdescription: Whether you're an educator or a parent, SPRK lessons give kids a fun crash course in programming robots while sharpening their skills in math and science.
hy-AM.sphero_beyond_shortdescription: SPRK lessons give kids a fun crash course in programming robots while sharpening skills in math and science.
hy-AM.start_hoc: Start the Hour of Code now
hy-AM.starwars_blocks_specs: Many languages | Modern browsers, smartphones, tablets | Ages 6-106
hy-AM.starwars_longdescription: Learn to program droids, and create your own Star Wars game in a galaxy far, far away.
hy-AM.starwars_name: Star Wars: Building a Galaxy with Code
hy-AM.starwars_shortdescription: Learn to program droids, and create your own Star Wars game in a galaxy far, far away.
hy-AM.stats_hoc_2013_heading: Incredible stats from last year's Hour of Code. In one week alone:
hy-AM.stats_michael: "I have never, ever seen my students so excited about learning." - Michael Clark, Teacher
hy-AM.stats_nina: "Every single day yielded the same results— 100% engagement." - Nina Nichols Peery, Teacher
hy-AM.stats_student: "I knew this was a once-in-a-lifetime chance." - Mariana Alzate, 5th grader
hy-AM.students_and_lines: %{students} students have done the Hour of Code and written %{lines} lines of code.
hy-AM.studiobar_donate_body: One child learns for each dollar you donate
hy-AM.studiobar_elementary_body: Our three new courses for K‑5
hy-AM.studiobar_flappy_body: Սարքիր և կիսվիր քո Flappy խաղով
hy-AM.studiobar_frozen_body: Create a winter wonderland with Anna and Elsa
hy-AM.studiobar_hoc_body: Learn to code with Angry Birds
hy-AM.studiobar_shop_body: Break stereotypes. Wear our logo with pride.
hy-AM.studiobar_teacher_body: Introduce Code Studio in your classroom
hy-AM.teacherled_longdescription: Now that tens of thousands of educators have tried the Hour of Code, many classrooms are ready for more creative, less one-size-fits-all activities that teach the basics of computer science. To help teachers find inspiration, we collected and curated one-hour teacher-led lesson and activity plans designed for different subject areas for Hour of Code veterans.
hy-AM.teacherled_shortdescription: Be inspired to design your own Hour of Code event with these lesson plans.
hy-AM.teachers_notes_hoc: Teachers: Read important educator notes here
hy-AM.teachingtree_beyond_longdescription: TeachingTree is an open platform that lets anybody organize educational content. Our goal is for students to quickly access the exact clips they need in order to learn individual concepts. Everyone is encouraged to help by adding videos or tagging concepts.
hy-AM.texasinstruments_longdescription: The 10 Minutes of Code activities can be used in class as a way to spark students' interest in coding with the TI technology they carry in their backpacks everyday.  Learn the basics of coding using the TI-84™ Plus and get started programming in just 10 minutes – no experience needed!
hy-AM.texasinstruments_shortdescription: Learn basic coding using the TI-84™ Plus calculator.
hy-AM.thinkersmith2_longdescription: Students learn about representing and storing letters in binary, as functions of on and off. At the end, the class gets to encode their own initials to take home with them.
hy-AM.thinkersmith2_shortdescription: Learn how computers use 1s and 0s to represent information
hy-AM.thinkersmith_longdescription: Using a pre-defined "Robot Vocabulary" students will figure out how to guide each other to accomplish specific tasks without discussing them first. This lesson teaches children the connection between symbols and actions, as well as the invaluable skill of debugging. "My Robotic Friends" works best as a group activity and includes a teacher workbook for classroom use.
hy-AM.thinkersmith_shortdescription: Unplugged tutorial for a group with no devices
hy-AM.third_party_appinv_desc: MIT App Inventor is a block-based programming tool that allows everyone, even novices, to start programming and build fully functional apps for Android devices. Newcomers to App Inventor can have their first app up and running in an hour or less, and can program more complex apps in significantly less time than with more traditional, text-based languages.
hy-AM.third_party_codecademy_desc: We are rethinking education from the bottom up. The web has rethought nearly everything - commerce, social networking, healthcare, and more. We are building the education the world needs - the first truly net native education.
hy-AM.third_party_codehs_btn_try: Intro CS Learn More for Schools
hy-AM.third_party_codehs_desc: CodeHS introduces the building blocks of programming with short videos, example code, and lots of programming exercises that make coding fun and accessible for beginners. For schools and teachers CodeHS provides curriculum, teacher tools and PD. For individual learners, you can get the help you need along the way from a network of tutors.
hy-AM.third_party_desc_10to12_kto3: Approximately 10-12 lessons, geared toward grades K-3
hy-AM.third_party_desc_10to12_kto5: Approximately 10-12 lessons, geared toward grades K-5
hy-AM.third_party_desc_11_kto5: Approximately 11 lessons, geared toward grades K-5
hy-AM.third_party_desc_20_4to12: More than 20 lessons, geared toward grades 4-12
hy-AM.third_party_desc_40_4to8: More than 40 lessons, geared toward grades 4-8
hy-AM.third_party_desc_dozens_kto8: Dozens of lessons for all grades K-8
hy-AM.third_party_khan_desc: Learn how to program drawings, animations, and games using JavaScript & ProcessingJS, or learn how to create webpages with HTML & CSS. You can share whatever you create, explore what others have created and learn from each other!
hy-AM.third_party_lightbot_desc: In Lightbot, students must program a robot with commands to solve puzzles. Students may play the game in the Browser (requires Flash Player), or on Android or iOS devices. Students play the initial set of “Basic” levels in Lightbot. They will learn how to tell a computer what to do with a series of basic commands and gain the general process by which computer programs are written.
hy-AM.third_party_price_school: School Price: Free Plans & Pro at $2500+
hy-AM.third_party_scratch_desc: With Scratch, you can program your own interactive stories, games, and animations and share your creations with others in the online community. Scratch helps young people learn to think creatively, reason systematically, and work collaboratively — essential skills for life in the 21st century.
hy-AM.third_party_scratchjr_desc: Scratch Jr. is an introductory programming language that enables young children (ages 5-7) to create their own interactive stories and games. Children snap together graphical programming blocks to make characters move, jump, dance, and sing. Children can modify characters in the paint editor, add their own voices and sounds, even insert photos of themselves - then use the programming blocks to make their characters come to life.
hy-AM.third_party_tynker_btn_curriculum: Try Tynker's Curriculum for Early Readers
hy-AM.third_party_tynker_desc: Tynker's creative computing platform helps children develop computational thinking and programming skills in a fun, intuitive and imaginative way. Our innovative visual programming language, interactive self-paced courses, and game-based programming activities provide an easy introduction to programming, and empower children to innovate and create.
hy-AM.touchdevelop_beyond_longdescription: TouchDevelop lets you create apps on iPad, iPhone, Android, PC, Mac, Windows Phone. Our touch-friendly editor makes coding fun, even on your phone or tablet!
hy-AM.touchdevelop_beyond_shortdescription: Code mobile apps directly on your phone, tablet or laptop
hy-AM.touchdevelop_longdescription: The touch-friendly editor will guide you in creating pixel art, solving the bear puzzle, or making your own jumping bird game.
hy-AM.touchdevelop_shortdescription: Solve puzzles, create games, and learn coding all on your phone.
hy-AM.twentyhours_heading: Try our Intro to Computer Science Course
hy-AM.twentyhours_text: Finished your first Hour of Code? Learn more core computer science and programming concepts in this follow-up course.
hy-AM.twitter_cs_foundational: Տեղեկատվական տեխնոլոգիաները ամեն մի աշակերտի ուսուցման հիմքն են. https://youtu.be/QvyTEx1wyOY:
hy-AM.twitter_teach_cs: 9 out of 10 people agree, schools should teach computer science. http://youtu.be/nKIu9yen5nc. Visit https://code.org/.
hy-AM.tynker_beyond_longdescription: Tynker makes it fun & easy to learn programming. It makes it visual. Kids build games and mobile apps by arranging blocks of code. It removes the need to know programming syntax. Kids transform ideas into animated stories and math art right away. It promotes progressive learning. As kids learn fundamentals, Tynker introduces more advanced concepts including syntax driven programming.
hy-AM.tynker_beyond_shortdescription: A fun and engaging course for children in grades 4-8
hy-AM.tynker_longdescription: Build your own games and share with friends! Solve fun coding puzzles and learn programming concepts in each level. Personalize games with animated characters, multiple levels and rich props. Make your games realistic using physics. See the code as visual blocks or JavaScript. Take your games mobile on iPads and Android tablets. Over a dozen fun activities to choose from!
hy-AM.tynker_shortdescription: Learn to code by solving fun puzzles and build your own mobile games.
hy-AM.tynkerapp_longdescription: Learn to program by solving fun coding puzzles. Easily build games and stories using with themed graphics, 10+ game-kits and customizable characters. No Internet connectivity required. You can also access your creations on the web.
hy-AM.tynkerapp_shortdescription: Learn to program by solving fun coding puzzles.
hy-AM.udacity_beyond_longdescription: In this course you will learn key concepts in computer science and learn how to write your own computer programs in the context of building a web crawler. There is no prior programming knowledge needed for this course. Beginners are welcome! At the end of this course, you will have learned key concepts in computer science and enough programming to be able to write Python programs to solve problems on your own. This course will prepare you to move on to intermediate-level computing courses.
hy-AM.udemy_beyond_longdescription: Whether you've never seen a line of code or you code for a living, Udemy has a course for you, taught by professional instructors. [Note: payment is required]
hy-AM.upgrade_ie_message: Code.org will soon remove support for Internet Explorer 8, 9, and 10. Please upgrade to a modern browser.
hy-AM.upgrade_ie_message_csedweek: CSEdWeek.org will soon remove support for Internet Explorer 8, 9, and 10. Please upgrade to a modern browser.
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_checkbox_c: I agree that teachers can contact me for volunteer opportunities (Note: your email address won't be shared)
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_field_desc: Describe your computer science experience or technical background and how you would like to participate as a volunteer for local teachers.
Description of experience and/or participation. If you speak language(s) other than English, be sure to include it here.
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_field_emai: Your email address will never be shared, but we'll send you requests from teachers.
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_field_loca: Your location will be used to allow teachers to search for nearby volunteers and will be shown as a pin on the map. If you are concerned about privacy, please use your work/school address or your city only.
I can volunteer by... (select all that apply)
ZIP code, city and state/country, or street address
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_final_para: You will be listed on a map for local teachers to contact you for the Hour of Code or other volunteer opportunities. Your email and exact address will NEVER be shared by us. But the other information (including approximate location) will be publicly viewable by local teachers.
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_header_pri: Information kept private and never shared
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_header_sha: Information shared with teachers on volunteer map
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_intro_back: The Hour of Code is a global movement to try an hour introduction to computer science, reaching tens of millions of students in 180+ countries. Please get involved during Computer Science Education Week, December 7-13.
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_location_f: visiting on-site at a school (1-2 hours in a classroom or a school assembly)
having a Q&A with students remotely (via short video conference)
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_subtitle_g: 100,000 teachers are going to host an Hour of Code in their classroom this year, Dec 7-13, 2015. They want your help!
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_subtitle_s:
%{num_teachers} teachers need volunteers.
%{num_volunteers} volunteers have signed up. Join them.
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_thankyou: Thank you for signing up to volunteer. Teachers will be using this map to search for and contact volunteers like you.
hy-AM.volunteer_engineer_submission_type_task_: I'm looking for a mentor to help prepare me for coding with my students
I want you to visit my classroom for technical help and inspiration
I want you to Skype into my classroom to say a few words of inspiration to the kids
hy-AM.w3schools_beyond_longdescription: Learn to create websites on your own computer. Learn the server basics in less than a day. Learn to add databases to your website
hy-AM.watch_inspirational_videos: Before you get started, watch one of these inspirational videos
